description_txt: stated on January 31, 2011 in a campaign news release:
quote_txt: Property tax exemptions can be granted to small businesses that move into Milwaukee County.

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2011 in a speech:
quote_txt: If you tried to pay out $1 trillion by handing it out at $1 per second, it would take more than 31,000 years.

description_txt: stated on January 4, 2011 in an interview on WCPN 90.3 FM:
quote_txt: "For [GM] to pay back everything it owes, it would have to sell its shares at $143 a share . . . where the highest value of a General Motors share ever was $43, $44, $46, whatever the dollars were . . ."

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2011 in an interview with President Obama:
quote_txt: The majority of people in polls do "not support Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2011 in an interview with President Barack Obama:
quote_txt: Tells President Barack Obama that he also asked former President George W. Bush about how he felt about Americans hating him.

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2011 in an interview on Fox:
quote_txt: Twelve judges have thrown out legal challenges to the health care law because they rejected "the notion that the health care law was unconstitutional."

description_txt: stated on February 7, 2011 in talking about his budget proposal.:
quote_txt: Says he never said he would keep education funding the same.

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2011 in a letter to the editor:
quote_txt: "Before this law was passed, Americans were told they could keep their current health care plans. After it became law, the administration issued regulations stating nearly half of Americans would lose their current plan."

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2011 in the State of the State speech:
quote_txt: Most state employees could pay twice as much toward their health care premiums and it would still be half the national average

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2011 in a television commercial:
quote_txt: "Some politicians … want to put new taxes on a lot of groceries."

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2011 in an interview on Super Bowl Sunday:
quote_txt: "I lowered taxes over the last two years."

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2011 in an interview on Super Bowl Sunday:
quote_txt: "I didn't raise taxes once."

description_txt: stated on February 2, 2011 in a floor speech.:
quote_txt: The military has spent $500 million enforcing the "Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell" policy regarding gays and lesbians in the military.

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2011 in a statement at a candidate forum:
quote_txt: The city building code violations on my properties only involve exterior issues; "within the households, it’s fine."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2011 in an interview on MSNBC:
quote_txt: "The last Christians are about to leave" Iraq.

description_txt: stated on December 23, 2010 in an e-mail:
quote_txt: Says "every school will be negatively impacted" if Education Stability Fund is not tapped.

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2011 in a budget presentation:
quote_txt: Georgia has some of the best maintained roads in America.

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2011 in a news conference:
quote_txt: Says an EPA permit "languished" under Strickland but his new EPA director got it done in two days.

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2011 in a news conference:
quote_txt: "United States students are achieving at number 25 out of 29 developing countries when it comes to science and math."

description_txt: stated on February 3, 2011 in a Twitter post.:
quote_txt: Says the Texas Forest Service planted 6,000 trees in the Dallas/Fort Worth area before the Super Bowl for unknown reasons at an unknown cost.

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "Illegal aliens cost the state of Rhode Island $400 million a year."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • February 6, 2011

description_txt: stated on January 4, 2011 in an interview on WCPN 90.3 FM:
quote_txt: Says getting ex-cons to successfully return to society is important "so we are not always faced constantly with recidivism, which is a big problem in the penitentiary today – in the 70 to 80 percent range."

description_txt: stated on January 25, 2011 in remarks on the floor of the Texas Senate:
quote_txt: "Ten retired nuns were barred from voting in the 2008 Indiana Democratic primary."

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2011 in a prepared statement:
quote_txt: Americans spend 6.1 billion hours a year complying with tax law. It costs us $163 billion to comply with our tax laws annually.

description_txt: stated on January 31, 2011 in his radio program:
quote_txt: Many of the 9/11 conspirators came from the Muslim Brotherhood, including Osama bin Laden, Ayman Zawahiri and Khalid Sheikh Mohammed.

description_txt: stated on February 4, 2011 in an interview with ABC News:
quote_txt: Israel's per capita income "is greater than probably three-fourths of the rest of the world."

description_txt: stated on January 31, 2011 in a radio ad.:
quote_txt: Congressman Robert Hurt has a plan to cut education by 40 percent.

description_txt: stated on January 30, 2011 in a newspaper column:
quote_txt: Under Hosni Mubarak's rule, "Egypt received more American dollars than any country besides Israel."

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2011 in a meeting with reporters and editors:
quote_txt: "All the money the Department of Citrus has is paid for by the citrus growers. You don't save dollars by eliminating the Department of Citrus."

description_txt: stated on January 27, 2011 in remarks to the Senate Tea Party caucus meeting.:
quote_txt: Federal Reserve policies have led to a 69 percent rise in corn prices, 44 percent rise in wheat prices and 15 percent spike in sugar prices over the last year.
